definition: lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely
fowl/chicken/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(slang) prostitute
to warn/to admonish
monkey/CL:隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: A tenacious auditor might want to make an example out of you.
sentences.chinese: 某個固執的審計員說不定想拿你來殺雞儆猴。

sentences.english: Gowardesh to consolidate position, decided to scare.
sentences.chinese: 狗娃爲鞏固地位，決定殺雞儆猴。

sentences.english: You were too busy making an example out of her to find the key that she left with me.
sentences.chinese: 你只想着用她來殺雞儆猴，沒想到找她留給我的鑰匙。

definition: please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
a short time/a little while

child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
to whisper to one another's ear
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world

definition: lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
(idiom) to have one's words turn out to be (tragically) prophetic
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
to behave unscrupulously

lit. to drive a duck onto a perch (idiom)/fig. to push sb to do sth way beyond their ability
